description: This course integrates on-campus classroom activities with service-learning placements in
and around Northfield. Scholarly readings, classroom discussions, and assignments
highlight the unique theoretical perspectives, skills, and methodological approaches that
psychologists use to address social problems and community needs through research,
practice, and policy. Students' on-site experiences and observations provide
opportunities for the application of previous coursework as well as guided reflection and
exploration of goals for personal and vocational development. Offered periodically.
